answers.answer: If it's type 1 diabetes where you're insulin dependent---yes, you can be discharged from the military. Why? If you go without your supplies on combat duties you could die since they can't always get it to you in a timely manner when you are god knows where country like Iraq. Type 2 which can be managed with diet and oral medication may not fall under  this classification. If you're a pilot, consider yourself grounded.I do not have the full text available but diabetes falls under Title 38--Pensions, Bonuses, and Veterans' ReliefCHAPTER I--DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRSPART 4--SCHEDULE FOR RATING DISABILITIESSection of; 4.119 Schedule of ratings--endocrine system.Thank you for serving our country.

question: I'm in the Air Force Reserves with twenty five years and just found out I have type II diabetes. My Question is will this get me discharged?
title: Type II diabetes
